item.description: A fun event to build the R community

item.description: A comprehensive guide to setup an R development environment for Ubuntu running in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)

item.title: How to efficiently calculate pairwise overlaps of many sets
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: An example of progressively optimizing the speed of a function

item.title: Some themes from rstudio::conf 2020
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: There were a lot of great talks at rstudio::conf. In this post I highlight a few of the themes that emerged for me.

item.title: Automate commits to GitHub from a CircleCI job
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: Automatically update your documentation or other repository content by authenticating CircleCI to push commits directly to GitHub

item.title: Debug your R package on CircleCI via Docker or SSH
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: If your CircleCI build is failing, you can interactively debug it locally or remotely.

item.title: CircleCI for R: Workflows, caches, and more
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: Enhance your continuous integration tests on CircleCI

item.title: Debug your R package on AppVeyor via Remote Desktop
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: If you can't replicate the error locally, you can access an AppVeyor server via Remote Desktop to interactively debug your R package.

item.title: Debug your R package on Travis CI via SSH
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: If you can't replicate the error locally, you can SSH into a Travis server to interactively debug your R package.

item.title: CircleCI for R: Motivation and basic setup
item.dc:creator: John Blischak
item.description: If you like using Docker, you should try out CircleCI for testing your R packages and projects.
